column4: I hear it's not possible to install to the new 2.6.17 kernel on Dapper, is that true?
you can, theoretically, install any kernel you feel like
Okay, I guess I was told that a lot of things would be broken and have problems.
'theoretically' :)
So you would have to be really smart and know what you're doing?
i don't know, i've never tried it :p
Oh, alright then.  Well that sucks.
why, is that your favourite kernel version?
I just read that the newest kernel would fix the problems with my sound and also it has better support for broadcom so my brother's wireless might work.
bcm43xx?
Yeah, I tried everything and can only get it to work if it is manually configured via iwconfig and ifconfig.
you can't put the iwconfig/ifconfig files into a script to automagically do it?
Unfortunately I'm not that smart.
just put the lines into a file
I actually copied and pasted some scripts that were on the bcm43xx howto and it worked once but never again for some reason.
and put that file, named 'foo' into /etc/init.d/, then do: update-rc.d foo default
So will that make it easy to switch between different wireless networks though?
not at all :p
have you tried blacklisting the bcm43xx driver and using ndiswrapper?
Ouch, well that sucks.  Stupid broadcom, I wish they would go out of business.
Yeah, I did try that and still didn't have success.
That's alright, I'll just have to keep hoping there is an easier way to get things going.
